div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 117 Tricca (mod. Trikkala), Thessaly, 1938 Burial: c. 300 B.C. (Oeconomides, Hackens) * Contents: 38 AR Alexander III: 1 tetradr. (Sicyon); 1 dr. Thessalian League: 2 double-vict.; 1 dr. Larissa: 1 dr. Boeotia: 28 st. Athens: 1 tetradr. (4th-3rd cent.) Aegina: 1 st. (archaic) Sicyon: 2 st. Disposition: Athens Varoucha, BCH 1938, p. 446; 1939, p. 288 * Assuming, as seems likely, that the Thes- salian coins are intrusive
